body:
We just port part of this pg bug fix for now which is fix out-of-range characters part, about the cancel_requested part, we will port in the future. 
Because postgres 9.6 adds some extra functions in regex code, e.g. cancel_requested logic. And this pg bug fix includes cancel_requested code. 
So, need more efforts to investigate whether we should add extra functions to regex code in the other commit.
@edespino, @paul-guo-, and @radarwave, please review.
@huor @zhangh43 @paul-guo- Please review this fix. Thank you.
@edespino, the source file in feature suite should be included in pom. Please create another jira to add the license header for the source file once the pom is updated.
Please feel free to merge when done
@edespino, please close this pr and we will update pom and add license header in source file in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HAWQ-1323

Closing this PR as @huor and team will be updating the pom.xml.  They will be adding ASF headers as appropriate to additional source files.

-=e
LGTM
@huor @paul-guo- @linwen please help review this pull request. thank you
@jiny2
@huor
+1 LGTM Thank you for improving RM component
Merged.

@denalex @linwen Please review it.

Merged into master. Close this PR.
Do not +x cpp files, else +1.
Merged.
Will fix access mode of *.cpp and *.c files in the other commit.
@amyrazz44, please close the pr it is done.
@jiny2, please close the pr if it is done.
@jiny2 @stanlyxiang pls feel free to review this pull request, thank you.
@edespino, is there any rule indicate which type of files need to be excluded in the RAT?
+1 LGMT
pushed into master branch
+1 while the func name need to be revised.
@huor - there are no such rules. Our use is dependent on our needs. My main goal is to avoid accidentally excluding files from being scanned.
LGTM
Please create 2.2.json in tools/bin/gppylib/data as a copy of 2.1.json
@ljainpivotalio i'll update it. ideally we shouldn't be maintaining version specific files for releases in git
Merged. (Discussed with ruilong. The filename executormgr_seterrcode_if_needed does not need a modification while move the NULL pointer check into the function.
LGTM
LGTM +1
+1 to bring travis back to green
@edespino, thanks for the update. +1
LGTM

The resulting RPM name is:

[root]# yum list installed | grep hawq
hawq-ranger-plugin_2_2_0_0.noarch 2.2.0.0-645.el6             @/hawq-ranger-plugin_2_2_0_0-2.2.0.0-645-dev.el6.noarch
hawq_2_2_0_0.x86_64               2.2.0.0-295.el6             installed
@vVineet ... as this work is on hold, can we close this PR and revive at a later point in time?
brew install python
The Apache RAT pom.xml file (root directory) needs to be updated as well: "<version>2.2</version>" --> "<version>2.1</version>"
LGTM

Thanks @denalex , the quote typo is fixed.
According to the Ranger document, Ranger will traverse all the deny conditions firstly to determine whether to disallow the access. And then traverse all the positive conditions.
LGTM +1
LGTM
LGTM
Merged.
LGTM +1
looks good to me +1
Merged.
+1 - I have validated the fix as well. I will be merging this into master.

One thing I would suggest is to be consistent in the use of the "<" and ">" characters used in the synopsis as the detailed option description.  As an example, the string "--config config_file" should instead be "--config <config_file>" to be consistent with the synopsis. BTW: this would make it consistent with the docs as well.
If you could refresh this PR with my comment above, I can review one last time and we can get this merged into master.

@denalex What do you mean by "even though with deny conditions access might not be determined, the RPS will continue to interpret it as access not allowed"?  Doesn't it inherit the processing the Ranger Basic Plugin?

@edespino - thanks for reviewing.  i added <> around the option arguments  as you suggested.

Shouldn't there be an update of the classpath files located in pxf/pxf-service/src/main/resources with:

```
/usr/lib/pxf/pxf-jdbc-*[0-9].jar
```

Should the vendor specific jdbc drivers also be added to these files?

@ictmalili -- yes, it inherits, but RPS does not check isAccessDetermined() flag on the BasePluginResponse. It only checks isAccessAllowed() flag and only if it is "true" it reports to HAWQ that access is allowed, all other cases are treated as access is not allowed.
@jiadexin java8 has stricter checks with code comments to be javadoc compatible. Please fix the above errors pointed by @edespino

OK. Got your point, Thanks @denalex 

This commit LGTM. +1

Hi @lisakowen , please add HAWQ-1056 prefix to commit message, so that we can easily track the apache jira and related fix.

If you don't open any apache jira for doc change, then maybe a simple and helpful prefix can be used, eg. "Doc updated: ... ".

Hope it get your attention at your next commit. Thanks.

I have a question: Is this for Ranger support only? If yes, should not enable-ranger be enough or better?

By the way, Shouldn't contrib/ranger-plugin be a better place for ranger-plugin?

Yes. This is for ranger support only. In our work, we avoid to confuse users with ranger and ranger-plugin. Because users should install ranger (apache ranger) before use HAWQ integration with Ranger. We should avoid the misleading that ranger has been installed&enabled if users configure hawq with option "enable-ranger".

For the plugin folder, agree with you as Postgresql says "contrib directory include porting tools, analysis utilities, and plug-in features that are not part of the core PostgreSQL system".  This part was committed by @denalex , we could discuss and file a jira to move if we reach a consensus.
@jiadexin - Thanks, I have confirmed the javadocs are now passing in my Java 8 environment.
As long as we are deleting tweets.tar.gz from source code we might also delete "<exclude>pxf/pxf-json/src/test/resources/tweets.tar.gz</exclude>" line in hawq/pom.xml.
Thanks @sansanichfb - pxf/pxf-json/src/test/resources/tweets.tar.gz has been removed from pom.xml

@liming01 @wengyanqing @stanlyxiang - thank you for noting that i did not follow the appropriate PR conventions.  i will make sure to squash commits and include the JIRA number in the commit message in future PRs.
LGTM. +1
LGTM
Merged into master. Close this PR.
Merged into master. Close this PR.

I'm wondering whether rename *.ans.orca
<https://github.com/apache/incubator-hawq/pull/1146#diff-6d2d67ad13a2a11e3e525ec0fff5be11>
->
*.orca.ans and for *.ans.planner -> *.planner.ans. This helps potential
wildcard processing in the future.

The line number could change again with code change. Maybe you could use
the init_file mechanism to avoid some ans file change.
